comments.content:
Detailed Report: https://oss-fuzz.com/testcase?key=5680824715051008

Project: libxml2
Fuzzing Engine: libFuzzer
Fuzz Target: xml
Job Type: libfuzzer_asan_libxml2
Platform Id: linux

Crash Type: Heap-use-after-free READ 4
Crash Address: 0x60c000000c48
Crash State:
  xmlTextReaderRead
  xml.c
  xmlTextReaderFreeNode
  
Sanitizer: address (ASAN)

Recommended Security Severity: High

Regressed: https://oss-fuzz.com/revisions?job=libfuzzer_asan_libxml2&range=202006050251:202006060253

Reproducer Testcase: https://oss-fuzz.com/download?testcase_id=5680824715051008

Issue filed automatically.

See https://google.github.io/oss-fuzz/advanced-topics/reproducing for instructions to reproduce this bug locally.
When you fix this bug, please
  * mention the fix revision(s).
  * state whether the bug was a short-lived regression or an old bug in any stable releases.
  * add any other useful information.
This information can help downstream consumers.

If you need to contact the OSS-Fuzz team with a question, concern, or any other feedback, please file an issue at https://github.com/google/oss-fuzz/issues. Comments on individual Monorail issues are not monitored.

This bug is subject to a 90 day disclosure deadline. If 90 days elapse
without an upstream patch, then the bug report will automatically
become visible to the public.

ClusterFuzz testcase 5680824715051008 is verified as fixed in https://oss-fuzz.com/revisions?job=libfuzzer_asan_libxml2&range=202008250617:202008260620

If this is incorrect, please file a bug on https://github.com/google/oss-fuzz/issues/new

Fixed here: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/libxml2/-/commit/ba589adc2f86c6be9ad7e0d771d4c9b09d059b89

Note that this is not a regression but a long-standing issue.

> Note that this is not a regression but a long-standing issue.

Hi Nick, I really appreciate your comments about whether issues are recent regressions or not.  It is a tremendous help when triaging these fuzzer fixes for back porting to shipping releases.
And thanks for fixing them so promptly, too!

This bug has been fixed for 30 days. It has been opened to the public.

- Your friendly Sheriffbot
